name: taunted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
taunt
to intentionally annoy and upset someone by making unkind remarks to them, laughing unkindly at them, etc.: The other kids used to taunt him in the playground because he was fat and wore glasses. The youngest in the group was taunted mercilessly. Synonym
bait
More examplesFewer examplesSome of the boys singled him out, laughing at him and taunting him.United's away fans enjoyed taunting their rivals.Opposing fans taunted him with chants and signs declaring him a drug cheat.
